neuroml.meta:notes: Complete network structure generated with project: Ex6_CerebellumDemo_copy saved with neuroConstruct v1.6.0 on: 16:20:10, 27-Jun-12

void.string:
Example of a section of the cerebellar cortex containing some of the main cell types. NOTE: this is NOT AN ELECTROPHYSIOLOGICALLY DETAILED CEREBELLUM MODEL and is only intended to reproduce some basic anatomical details of cerebellar connectivity to illustrate neuroConstruct's functionality; none of the cells have realistic sets of ion channels.
Any resemblance with the actual spiking behaviour of the cerebellum is entirely coincidental...
Just click Generate -> Generate Cell Positions and Connections, followed by Visualisation -> View, with Latest Generated Positions selected to see the demo.
To run in NEURON go to Simulation Settings -> Create files for local execution, and then run the hoc file. The location of the NEURON home directory may need to be set under Settings. To view the data again, go to Visualisations, press Previous Simulations..., select the recorded simulation and press OK.
This is the default configuration of the Cell Groups, stimulations, plots, etc for this project
Similar to default simulation, but with a number of Golgi cells added

cell.name: MossyFiber
cell.meta:notes: A simple cell for testing purposes only

cell.name: GranuleCell
cell.meta:notes: A very simplified cerebellar Granule like Cell for testing purposes only

cell.name: PurkinjeCell
cell.meta:notes: A very simplified Purkinje Cell for testing purposes only

cell.name: GolgiCell
cell.meta:notes: A very simplified cerebellar Golgi like Cell for testing purposes only

channel_type.name: KConductance

status.meta:comment: Equations adapted from HH paper for modern convention of external potential being zero

channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of K conductance in squid giant axon. Based on channel from Hodgkin and Huxley 1952

meta:publication.meta:fullTitle: A. L. Hodgkin and A. F. Huxley, A quantitative description of membrane current and its application to conduction and excitation in nerve, J. Physiol., vol. 117, pp. 500-544, 1952.

channel_type.name: NaConductance

status.meta:comment: Equations adapted from HH paper for modern convention of external potential being zero

channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of Na conductance in squid giant axon. Based on channel from Hodgkin and Huxley 1952

meta:publication.meta:fullTitle: A. L. Hodgkin and A. F. Huxley, A quantitative description of membrane current and its application to conduction and excitation in nerve, J. Physiol., vol. 117, pp. 500-544, 1952.

channel_type.name: PassiveCond
channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of a leak/passive conductance. Note: for GENESIS cells with a single leak conductance, it is better to use the Rm and Em variables for a passive current.
